title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: GIS one epidemiology’s bestest friends. Sadly, GIS data can also pain. shape file broke ? Bummer. None shape names match anything ? Ouch. local government just restructured administrative divisions now work useless ? Sad face. package doesn’t really fix issues, designed data repository GIS data Epicentre shapes names vetted match appears datasets. epimaps can easily load map data whichever project want avoid constant name validation scripts exacerbate risk future failure.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo — drc_zone
Democratic Republic of the Congo — drc_zone
Load map — load_map
text: Returns user-specified map either sf tibble format.

title: Load map — load_map
code: load_map(   country,   level = c("zone", "reg", "nat"),   as = c("sf", "tibble", "data.table") )

title: Load map — load_map
text: country str Country load. level str Level geographic resolution use, either : zone, reg (regional), nat (national). Default 'zone'. str Type output desired, either : 'sf', 'tibble', 'data.table'. Default 'sf'.

title: Load map — load_map
code: drc <- load_map('drc') plot(drc)   drc <- load_map(country = 'drc',                 level = 'reg',                 as = 'data.table') head(drc) #> NULL
